install an existing .vimrc or init.vim file

go to FisaDev and follow instructions to download config files ~/.vimrc (Vim) and ~/.config/nvim/init.vim (Neovim). Available from github.

troubleshoot your neovim installation

You may have to install the latest version of neovim from ~HEAD

softwareupdate --all --install --force
sudo xcode-select --install
brew install luv
#brew unlink luajit
#brew unlink neovim
brew install --HEAD luarocks
brew install --HEAD luajit
brew install --HEAD neovim
rm ~/.config/coc

Fix your python installation (you may have to restart your terminal for changes to take effect)

brew install pyenv              # curl https://pyenv.run | bash
brew install pyenvvirtualenv
pyenv install --list | grep 3.9
pyenv install 3.9.1
pyenv install --list | grep 2.7.18
pyenv install 2.7.18

You’ll have to add this to your .bashrc or .zshrc to have your pyenv works

eval "$(pyenv init -)"
eval "$(pyenv virtualenv-init -)"

And fix your neovim python provider

pyenv virtualenv 3.9.1 neovim3
pyenv activate neovim3
pip install pynvim flake8 pylint isort
pip install --upgrade pip

pyenv virtualenv 2.7.18 neovim2
pyenv activate neovim2
pip install pynvim flake8 pylint isort
pip install --upgrade pip

Once your python environment installed, make sure neovim configuration init.vim contains the below:

let g:python3_host_prog = '~/.pyenv/versions/neovim3/bin/python'
let g:python_host_prog =  '~/.pyenv/versions/neovim2/bin/python'

Intellisense with CoC - Conquer Of Completion

Install language extensions for CoC

:CocInstall coc-pyright coc-snippets coc-vimlsp coc-json coc-tsserver

In corporate environment where TLS inspection is enforced, the above vim command will fail to find the certificate issuer. The remediation is to to add the CA certificate to your node env:

export NODE_EXTRA_CERTS=<path of your pem certificate>
